Jason Charnesky and Bruce Trinkley are two peas in a pod PERIOD

The duo sipped iced tea slightly sweetened with Sweet and Low and said they have been writing music theatre works together for years PERIOD

Charnesky an English instructor at Penn State who claims he has no musical knowledge writes the lyrics for each production PERIOD After the words are written Trinkley a retired music professor fills in with his musical expertise PERIOD

 Trinkley said PERIOD

Their newest piece ConfessConfuse  shows tonight PERIOD The piece features four short  all completely different stories PERIOD

The pair began their collaboration in  when new pieces of artwork were coming to the Palmer Museum of Art PERIOD

The specific piece of artwork that inspired them was  by artist Fernando Botero PERIOD

They researched Santa Rosalia for the piece and discovered she was the patron saint of Sicily and the plague PERIOD

After their indepth research of the saint they visited Botero  only to find out Santa Rosalia was never the inspiration for the painting PERIOD

As it turned out he simply named the painting after it was finished PERIOD

Bummed by their discovery the pair decided to write a piece featuring four solo singers three playing art critics and the other playing Botero PERIOD

 Charnesky said PERIOD

To bring relevance to todays issues the final part of the composition was written about AIDS instead of the plague by the end of the piece each singer has fallen out one by one PERIOD

 Charnesky said PERIOD

The two are members of the National Opera Association an organization that helped get their playwriting careers going PERIOD

Every year the association holds a competition in which the winner gets their piece produced PERIOD

After winning the first year and continuing to make it to the finals in the competition they have gotten a number of

their works produced at the association which in part helped them make a name for themselves PERIOD

 Trinkley said PERIOD

 Charnesky said PERIOD

Firm on his stance Trinkley did not agree PERIOD

 Trinkley said PERIOD

Even peas in a pod disagree sometimes even if they can finish each others sentences PERIOD
